manhattan.name: Manhattan
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir for about 30 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
manhattan.description: A bold, boozy mix of whiskey, sweet vermouth, and bitters. The Manhattan is a classic cocktail dating back to the late 1800s.

whiskey-sour.name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Add bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white to a shaker without ice and dry shake for 15 seconds.
Add ice and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Add a few dashes of Angostura bitters on the foam.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
whiskey-sour.description: A refreshing blend of whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup. The egg white creates a silky texture and frothy top.

old-fashioned.name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Add demerara syrup and bitters to a rocks glass.
Add whiskey and stir.
Add a large ice cube and stir until well-chilled.
Express the orange and lemon peels over the drink and use as garnish.
old-fashioned.description: A classic combination of whiskey, sugar, bitters, and an orange twist. One of the oldest known cocktails, dating back to the early 1800s.

gin-tonic.name: Gin and Tonic
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour gin over the ice.
Top with tonic water and gently stir.
Squeeze lime wedge over drink and drop it in as garnish.
gin-tonic.description: A crisp and bubbly mix of gin and tonic water with lime. Originally created by British officers in India who mixed quinine tonic with gin to make it more palatable.

tom-collins.name: Tom Collins
instructions: Combine gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into a collins glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda and gently stir.
Garnish with orange wedge and cherry.
tom-collins.description: A refreshing mix of gin, lemon juice, and club soda. Named after a widespread practical joke that swept across New York in 1874.

gin-fizz.name: Gin Fizz
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white to a shaker without ice and dry shake for 15 seconds.
Add ice and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain into a highball glass without ice.
Top with a splash of club soda (about 1 oz).
Wait for the foam to settle and rise before serving.
gin-fizz.description: A frothy, refreshing classic featuring gin, citrus, and the silky texture of egg white. The Ramos Gin Fizz variation adds cream and orange flower water for extra decadence.

negroni.name: Negroni
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled, about 30 seconds.
Strain into a rocks glass with a large ice cube.
Garnish with an orange twist.
negroni.description: A bitter, complex mix of gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth. Legend has it that Count Camillo Negroni created it in Florence in 1919 when he asked for gin instead of soda in his Americano.

gin-rickey.name: Gin Rickey
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add gin and lime juice.
Top with club soda and stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
gin-rickey.description: A refreshing mix of gin, lime juice, and club soda. Named after lobbyist Colonel Joe Rickey, who created the original version with bourbon in the 1880s.

dark-stormy.name: Dark and Stormy
ingredients: 2 oz Dark rum (preferably Gosling's Black Seal)
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add lime juice and ginger beer.
Float the dark rum on top by pouring it slowly over the back of a spoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
dark-stormy.description: A spicy-sweet mix of dark rum and ginger beer with a splash of lime. The official drink of Bermuda, where Gosling's Black Seal rum originates.

mojito.name: Mojito
instructions: Lightly muddle the mint leaves in a shaker with simple syrup.
Add rum, lime juice, and ice. Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with soda water and stir gently.
Garnish with a mint sprig.
mojito.description: A refreshing mix of light rum, mint, and lime juice. This classic Cuban cocktail has been popular since the early 1900s.

daiquiri.name: Daiquiri
instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
daiquiri.description: A classic mix of light rum, lime juice, and simple syrup. Named after a beach near Santiago, Cuba, where the drink was supposedly invented in the early 1900s.

margarita.name: Margarita
instructions: Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a rocks glass and dip in salt.
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
margarita.description: A tart, salty-sweet classic with tequila, lime juice, and orange liqueur. One of the most popular cocktails in the world, with dozens of origin stories dating to the 1930s and 40s.

oaxacan-old-fashioned.name: Oaxacan Old Fashioned
instructions: Add all ingredients except the orange twist to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass with a large ice cube.
Flame an orange peel over the drink, then rub around the rim of the glass and drop in as garnish.
oaxacan-old-fashioned.description: Death & Co's famous twist on the classic, combining mezcal and tequila with agave syrup and bitters. Created by Phil Ward, it showcases the complementary flavors of tequila and mezcal.

under-volcano.name: Under the Volcano
instructions: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
No garnish required.
under-volcano.description: A smoky, herbal cocktail from the legendary Hawthorne in Boston, MA. Named after Malcolm Lowry's novel, it balances the smoke of mezcal with amaro's herbal complexity and sherry's nutty richness.

moscow-mule.name: Moscow Mule
instructions: Fill a copper mug or highball glass with ice.
Add vodka and lime juice.
Top with ginger beer and stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
moscow-mule.description: A zingy combo of vodka, ginger beer, and lime, typically served in a copper mug. Created in 1941 as a marketing collaboration to sell vodka and ginger beer in America.

vodka-martini.name: Vodka Martini
ingredients: Lemon twist or olive for garnish
instructions: Add vodka and vermouth to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled, about 30 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or olive.
vodka-martini.description: A sophisticated mix of vodka and dry vermouth. While the gin martini is the original, the vodka version gained immense popularity in the mid-20th century.

aperol-spritz.name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
Add Prosecco, then Aperol, then a splash of soda water.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange slice.
aperol-spritz.description: A light and bubbly Italian aperitif made with Aperol, Prosecco, and soda water. The iconic orange aperitivo of Northern Italy, perfect for pre-dinner drinks.

grasshopper.name: Grasshopper
instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with chocolate shavings.
grasshopper.description: A creamy, minty dessert cocktail that's heavy and indulgent. Created at Tujague's in New Orleans in the early 20th century, it's a perfect after-dinner drink.

martini.name: Martini
ingredients: Lemon twist or olive for garnish
instructions: Add gin and vermouth to a mixing glass with ice.
Stir until well-chilled, about 30 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or olive.
martini.description: A sophisticated mix of gin and dry vermouth.

mezcal-sour.name: Smoked Mezcal Sour
instructions: Add all ingredients except bitters to a shaker without ice and dry shake for 15 seconds.
Add ice and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Add a few dashes of orange bitters on top of the foam.
Garnish with a dehydrated orange wheel and a sprinkle of chili powder.
mezcal-sour.description: This smoky cocktail is a twist on the classic whiskey sour, combining the flavors of mezcal and tequila with a hint of spice from habanero shrub and froth from the egg to refresh in the spring heat.

orange-margarita.name: Orange Margarita
instructions: Rim a rocks glass with Tajín and set aside.
Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange wheel and lime wedge.
orange-margarita.description: This refreshing margarita is a perfect summer drink, combining the flavors of tequila and orange with a hint of spice from Tajín and habanero shrub.

blackberry-bramble.name: Blackberry Bramble
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and honey syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Drizzle Chambord and blackberry shrub over the top.
Add a few dashes of golden bitters.
Garnish with fresh blackberries and a lemon wheel.
blackberry-bramble.description: This herbal cocktail combines the flavors of gin and blackberries with a hint of sweetness from honey syrup and Chambord.

ginger-gin-fizz.name: Ginger Gin Fizz
instructions: Add gin and lime juice to a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with ginger soda.
Add a few dashes of Angostura bitters.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a lime wheel and candied ginger.
ginger-gin-fizz.description: This fizzy refresher mixes gin and ginger for a light, sweet, bubbly drink.

blackberry-whiskey-sour.name: Blackberry Sour
instructions: Add bourbon, honey syrup, lemon juice, blackberry shrub, and egg white to a shaker without ice and dry shake for 15 seconds.
Add ice and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Float Chambord on top.
Add a few dashes of Angostura bitters on the foam.
Garnish with fresh blackberries and a lemon twist.
blackberry-whiskey-sour.description: This blackberry whiskey sour takes the classic cocktail to the next level with the addition of muddled blackberries and a float of Chambord.

honeysuckle.name: Honeysuckle
instructions: Add white rum, honey syrup, and lime juice to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
honeysuckle.description: This summer cocktail combines the flavors of white rum and honey syrup with a hint of lime for a light, sweet drink.
